channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8350] enable ChaosMonkey to run commands as different users
item.description: CM should be able to run under different user than the user under which hbase is running. Current options are insufficient to achieve that... it should ssh under configurable user, or sudo
item.summary: enable ChaosMonkey to run commands as different users

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
+    }

+    sshUserName = conf.get("hbase.it.clustermanager.ssh.user", "");

+    String extraSshOptions = conf.get("hbase.it.clustermanager.ssh.opts", "");

+    sshOptions = System.getenv("HBASE_SSH_OPTS");

Since these are user-facing configuration points (we want to use hbase-it as smoke-test for user installs, right?), please move them to HConstants.

+      String userAndHost = sshUserName.isEmpty() ? hostname : (sshUserName + "@" + hostname);

You could alternatively use -l login_name. Whichever makes the code simpler.

+1

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12579058/HBASE-8350-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestOpenedRegionHandler
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestTableLockManager

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5333//testReport/

please move them to HConstants.

We should keep those close to where they are used. HConstants is too generic for those.

Patch looks good overall, two things:

  • Let's do RemoteShell protected. Some other ClusterManager implementations might make use of it, so they can extend HBaseCM.
  • Please add some documentation to the it section in the book about these conf settings.
CR feedback. 94 patch is trivial so I will backport final patch on commit.
Lars Hofhansl should be ok for 94? Test/doc only
+1 (patches like this you can always just commit to 0.94 if you got some +1's)
